image.altText: A large white building with a metal coat of arms out the front.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory parliament has passed a bill creating an Integrity and Ethics Commissioner. It will take responsibility for four integrity bodies in the territory, including the anti-corruption watchdog.

title.children: NT Integrity and Ethics Commissioner established amid opposition

image.altText: A group of people standing outside of court, holding a sign that reads "Save our springs".

props.synopsis: Dozens of Aboriginal Territorians from remote communities travelled to Darwin where they stand alongside Environment Centre NT in a bid to axe a controversial water allocation plan.

title.children: 'Ancient and fragile': Dispute over groundwater reaches Supreme Court

image.altText: A road, viewed from above, is covered in leaves and tree branches.

props.synopsis: The rare November cyclone, with wind gusts at its core reaching almost 200km/h, pushed over massive trees and damaged homes, cars and infrastructure when it passed Darwin.

title.children: Trees toppled, cars crushed, thousands without power: TC Fina in pictures

image.altText: Police vehicles parked in front of a house between trees.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering 23-year-old student is facing trial in the NT Supreme Court, with the jury shown video footage of the home where Md Isfaqur Rahman died.

title.children: 'I'm coming back': Murder trial hears of victim's chance meeting with accused

image.altText: A tree has fallen over the fence of a remote home, it is lying over a power line nearby.

props.synopsis: While Darwin experienced the outer edge of Severe Tropical Cyclone Fina this weekend, the eye of the storm came much closer to the Tiwi Islands. Locals in Wurrumiyanga share their experiences with the ABC.

title.children: Tiwi Islanders tell of 'pretty terrifying' night as Fina battered their homes

image.altText: a firefighter tackles flames in a forest fire

props.synopsis: Eastern Australia is facing a barrage of extreme weather conditions this week, and for many areas the most intense conditions will arrive today.

title.children: Wild day of weather predicted for Australia's east

image.altText: An illustration of four hands grabbing into a paper written 'Work and Holiday Visa'.

props.synopsis: Thousands of young Indonesians want the chance to come to Australia to work, but first they have to win a visa application "war" that puts them in the sights of scammers and dodgy operators promising them what they want — for a price.

title.children: 'The names have been selected': Crooked operators rig working visas

image.altText: A smiling blond child of four years of age with curly hair

props.synopsis: A renewed police search for missing four-year-old Gus is expected to enter its second day, with no indication of any clues revealed so far.

title.children: Mine search for Gus expected to resume as locals tell of shock

image.altText: Ted O'Brien with Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Ted O'Brien will address the National Press Club on Wednesday.

title.children: Coalition makes tax cut pitch in bid to restore credibility among young

image.altText: A white flower with big red spots on the petals is found nestled in the earth.

props.synopsis: A team of researchers describe the "magical" experience of finding a rare species of flower in bloom deep in the Sumatran rainforest after a 23-hour trek.

title.children: Researcher cries after finding rare flower in Indonesia

image.altText: Jim Chalmers presser

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers has denied he asked federal departments to cut staff and slash budgets after the government requested savings be found. Follow live.

title.children: Chalmers denies he directed public service to make cuts to find savings

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Annual inflation ticks up in October
Voter study shows Coalition loses status as better economic manager
Chalmers denies he directed public service to make cuts to find savings

image.altText: Shoppers walk past a shop window with a 'Sale $15 items' sign

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has risen sharply ahead of the latest monthly inflation figures from the ABS. It follows an upbeat session on Wall Street as the odds of a December interest rate cut jumped above 80 per cent. Meanwhile, oil prices have fallen sharply on reports of Ukraine's intention to enter a US-brokered peace deal with Russia. Follow live.

title.children: Australian shares jump ahead of inflation data

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Lower fuel and electricity prices to weigh on Australian inflation
Healthcare and consumer stocks lead ASX surge

image.altText: A young toddler boy stands in muddy water flooding tents around him.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain causes significant flooding in Gaza, with thousands of Palestinians living in tents bearing the brunt of the sudden burst of winter weather.

title.children: Palestinians left without shelter after Gaza tent cities flood again

image.altText: A brown silo with the words Tarago written on it, with a street in its background

props.synopsis: Farmers near Tarago in southern New South Wales fear a proposed waste-to-energy incinerator could threaten their health and livelihoods.

title.children: Sydney's rubbish leaves farmers feeling like 'second-class citizens'

image.altText: a sign saying "Waranyjarri Estate" with red empty dirt in the background

props.synopsis: A number of people slept in front of a real estate office in Western Australia's far north on Monday night in an attempt to purchase a block of land.

title.children: Unusual scenes as people camp out to buy land in regional WA

image.altText: A house on fire.

props.synopsis: Police believe arsonists targeted a home in Melbourne's inner west overnight, forcing a family to flee the property.

title.children: Police believe Melbourne house fire was targeted attack

image.altText: Two mean wearing white jumpsuits peer at a footpath using a torch in front of a white car.

props.synopsis: Forensics has provided the biggest breakthrough in criminal justice in the last century. It's also become the perfect subject matter for TV crime shows. But do you know forensic facts from fiction? Take our quiz to find out.

title.children: Think you're detective material? Take our quiz to find out

image.altText: A young, dark-haired boy in a bushy area.

props.synopsis: The grieving parents of a four-year-old boy who drowned in a suburban lagoon are suing Melbourne Water and a council over the tragedy.

title.children: Parents of drowned boy sue over 'inadequate' fence

image.altText: Large piles of coal are stacked on the ground with loading machinery above them.

props.synopsis: A newly formed Queensland company has taken over a majority shareholding in a Bowen Basin coal mine, securing 1,000 jobs.

title.children: Premier says newly formed Queensland company secures 1,000 coal mining jobs

image.altText: An armed guard standing outside the glass entrance to the Louvre.

props.synopsis: Four other people were already arrested and placed under formal investigation on October 29 and November 1.

title.children: Four more arrested in connection with Louvre jewel heist

image.altText: A composite of Xi Jinping and Sanae Takaichi

props.synopsis: The incident comes amid an ongoing diplomatic spat between Tokyo and Beijing.

title.children: Japan scrambles jets after suspected Chinese drone spotted near Taiwan

image.altText: US Senator Mark Kelly speaking to the media in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: It comes after the six US politicians appeared in a social media video that Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth described as "seditious".

title.children: FBI to interview Democrats who urged US military to ignore illegal orders

image.altText: Bees sit covering a beehive frame

props.synopsis: The cost of treating varroa mite in the beekeeping industry is flowing onto other food growers reliant on pollination.

title.children: Varroa mite infestations could see mass exodus from industry as costs increase

image.altText: a man and a toddler in the surf

props.synopsis: The ABC has heard of a five-year-old's distress at being unable to speak with her father in a Tasmanian prison. Workers say that lockdowns due to staff shortages are to blame.

title.children: 'When will I see my dad?': 5yo's distress at frequently cancelled prison calls

image.altText: A close up photo of a beige yellow coral, which is about to release tiny pink and white spawn.

props.synopsis: From growing baby coral in floating pools to using Indigenous cultural knowledge, this trial hopes to regrow the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Ceramic 'seeding' devices and floating pools used in battle to save reef

image.altText: NSW Police attend a fatal stabbing at Rouse Hill

props.synopsis: A boy is arrested and charged with murder after Riot Squad police raid a home in Rouse Hill.

title.children: Second 15yo charged with murder after fatal Sydney stabbing

image.altText: Sharon Ah Chee and Tim Agius sit on a a park bench while a small white and brown dog with a black harness sits on Tim's lap

props.synopsis: Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara (APY) Lands community members have been left disappointed by a last-minute decision to halt a hearing that was set to probe governance issues in the region.

title.children: APY Lands governance hearing delayed indefinitely

image.altText: A woman taking a selfie with a man and three young children, whose faces have been blurred.

props.synopsis: The family's alternative lifestyle came under scrutiny after the British-Australian couple and their three children were hospitalised last year with mushroom poisoning.

title.children: Children removed from Australian-British couple living off-grid in Italian forest

image.altText: Minjee Lee looks on during a practice round at the Tour Championship in Naples, Florida.

props.synopsis: After winning her third major at the Women's PGA Championship, Minjee Lee caps off the year by claiming Australian golf's highest individual honour.

title.children: Lee's resurgence recognised with fourth Greg Norman Medal

image.altText: Cristiano Ronaldo of Portugal reacts before being shown a red card during a World Cup qualifying match.

props.synopsis: Cristiano Ronaldo will likely avoid missing any Portugal matches at the men's World Cup, despite receiving a red card in a qualifier.

title.children: Ronaldo set to avoid World Cup ban as FIFA confirms draw shake-up

image.altText: Ellie Johnston and Bridget Patterson of the Adelaide Strikers embrace after their WBBL win over Brisbane Heat.

props.synopsis: With scores ties before the last delivery of the match, the Adelaide Strikers pull off a tense victory over the struggling Brisbane Heat.

title.children: Strikers pip winless Heat in final-ball WBBL thriller

image.altText: A dark-haired WAFL player holds up her hands to encourage her teammates during a match.

props.synopsis: Emma Kearney says the pressure is on other clubs in the AFLW to raise their standard to North Melbourne's ahead of the club's third straight grand final.

title.children: Roos star puts heat on AFLW battlers to lift standards ahead of grand final

image.altText: Members of the Indian women's football team are gathered together, celebrating

props.synopsis: Ranked 63rd in the world, India will need to finish ahead of Japan, Vietnam and Chinese Taipei to progress through next year's Women's Asian Cup and have a chance at their first-ever World Cup qualification.

title.children: India a 'realistic' chance to qualify for FIFA Women's World Cup: coach
